medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, chills, myalgias, headache, and dysuria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five days before hospitalization, with a recorded temperature of 38.8Â°C. The patient had a recurrence of similar symptoms approximately three months prior, which responded to ciprofloxacin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hospitalized three months earlier for fever and dysuria; urine and blood cultures were negative at that time.
medical_history.family_history: One brother had a remote history of exposure to tuberculosis; the patient was unsure of his own exposure.
medical_history.social_history: Immigrated from Greece 35 years ago, spent years in merchant marine traveling to various countries including Greece; consumed cheese made from unpasteurized milk a year prior. The patient did not smoke or drink.
